The classic debate of the chicken and the egg... What did come first? Was the egg created before the chicken or did the chicken somehow come into existense first? The turmoil...! emoticon_xchicken 
 
 Personally, I believe that the egg had to have come first. The creature that created the egg was not fully evolved into the defined chicken of today. It was just a more primitive form. The egg it created was one step up in evolution defining it as a chicken!

Egg as the proto-chicken eventually evolves until it lays the first real chicken egg, this is then boiled and eaten with toastie soldiers, the second egg laid becomes the chicken.
 so yes your quite right, and welcome to the forum thing.

 Then why did you vote for chicken in your own poll?

So the egg got laid, huh?:p emoticon_xclown emoticon_xgood emoticon_smile
 Lucky egg.
 
 
 Actually, I don't think either came first. I think there was a whole line of animals that came along well before the chickens. They were called Dinosaurs. You can go back further if you want. Infact, why not. There could have been species of fish older than the first chicken. I mean come on. You gotta give credit where credit is due.
 
 By the way, as much as I like chicken, I don't like fried foods. So I'm going for the scrambled egg.
